intro: Apteranthes europaea var. decipiens, commonly known as the European false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its basal leaves with lobed margins and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
